xxl.collections
Class ArrayQueue

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.collections.AbstractQueue
        |
        +--xxl.collections.ArrayQueue
public class ArrayQueue
extends AbstractQueue
implements FIFOQueue

This class provides a resizable-array implementation of the Queue interface with a FIFO (first in, first out) strategy. It implements the peek method but not the remove method. In addition to implementing the Queue interface, this class provides methods to access directly the array that is internally used to store the queue.

Each ArrayQueue instance has a capacity. The capacity is the size of the array used to store the elements in the queue. It is always at least as large as the queue size. As elements are inserted into an ArrayQueue, its capacity may grow automatically. The details of the growth policy are specified by the ArrayResizer.

The array is used as a circular storage for the queue to avoid the shift of the whole queue when the first element is removed. Therefore a field is needed to store the index of the first element in the array.

Example usage (1). 

     // create a new array
 
     Object[] array = new Object[] {
         new Integer(1),
         new Integer(2),
         new Integer(3),
         new Integer(4),
         new Integer(5)
     };
 
     // create a new array queue with the given array
 
     ArrayQueue queue = new ArrayQueue(array);
 
     // print all elements of the queue
 
     while (queue.hasNext())
         System.out.println(queue.next());
 
      // close the open queue after use
 
      queue.close();
Example usage (2). 
     // create a new array queue with the first three elements of the given array
 
     queue = new ArrayQueue(3, array);
 
     // print all elements of the queue
 
     while (queue.hasNext())
         System.out.println(queue.next());
 
      // close the open queue after use
 
      queue.close();
Example usage (3). 
     // create a new iterator containing the elements of the given array
 
     Cursor cursor = new ArrayCursor(array);
 
     // create a new empty array queue
 
     queue = new ArrayQueue();
 
     // insert all elements of the given iterator into the queue
 
     queue.insertAll(cursor);
 
     // print all elements of the queue
 
     while (queue.hasNext())
         System.out.println(queue.next());
 
      // close the open queue and cursor after use
 
      queue.close();
      cursor.close();
Example usage (4). 
     // create a new empty queue with a growth policy managed by new ArrayResizer(0.5, 0.6, 0.4)
 
     queue = new ArrayQueue(0.5, 0.6, 0.4);
 
     // insert and remove 20 elements and print after each operation the size of the queue and
     // the internally used array
 
     System.out.println("queue.size()="+queue.size()+" & "
                        +"queue.array.length="+queue.array.length);
     for (int i = 1; i < 21; i++) {
         queue.insert(new Integer(i));
         System.out.println("queue.size()="+queue.size()+" & "
                             +"queue.array.length="+queue.array.length);
     }
     while (queue.hasNext()) {
         queue.next();
         System.out.println("queue.size()="+queue.size()+" & "
                            +"queue.array.length="+queue.array.length);
     }
 
      // close the open queue after use
 
      queue.close();

See Also:
ArrayResizer, Function, Iterator, NoSuchElementException

Field Detail

FACTORY_METHOD

public static final Function FACTORY_METHOD
A factory method to create a new ArrayQueue (see contract for FACTORY_METHOD in interface Queue). It may be invoked with an array (parameter list) (for further details see Function) of object arrays, an iterator or without any parameters. An array (parameter list) of object arrays will be used to initialize the internally used array with the object array at index 0 and an iterator will be used to insert the contained elements into the new ArrayQueue.
See Also:
Function

resizer

protected ArrayResizer resizer
An ArrayResizer managing the growth policy for internally used array. The ArrayResizer decides before an insertion or after an removal of an element whether the array is to be resized or not.
See Also:
ArrayResizer

array

protected Object[] array
The array is internally used to store the elements of the queue. Before an insertion and after the removal of an element this array is automatically resized by an ArrayResizer.

size

protected int size
An int field storing the number of elements in this queue.

first

protected int first
An int field storing the index of the first element of the queue in the array.
Constructor Detail

ArrayQueue

public ArrayQueue(int size,
                  Object[] array,
                  double fmin,
                  double fover,
                  double funder)
           throws IllegalArgumentException
Constructs a queue containing the elements of the specified array with a growth polity that depends on the specified double parameters. The field array is set to the specified array, the field size is set to the specified size and the field resizer (growth policy) is initialized by the constructor ArrayResizer(fmin, fover, funder).
Parameters:
size - the number of elements of the specified array which should be used to initialize the internally used array.
array - the object array that is used to initialize the internally used array.
fmin - a control parameter for the growth policy.
fover - a control parameter for the growth policy.
funder - a control parameter for the growth policy.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the specified size argument is negative, or if it is greater than the length of the specified array.
See Also:
ArrayResizer.ArrayResizer(double, double, double)

public ArrayQueue(Object[] array,
                  double fmin,
                  double fover,
                  double funder)
Constructs a queue containing the elements of the specified array with a growth polity that depends on the specified double parameters. This constructor is equivalent to the call of ArrayQueue(array.length, array, fmin, fover, funder).
Parameters:
array - the object array that is used to initialize the internally used array.
fmin - a control parameter for the growth policy.
fover - a control parameter for the growth policy.
funder - a control parameter for the growth policy.

fmin - a control parameter for the growth policy.
fover - a control parameter for the growth policy.

ArrayQueue

ArrayQueue

public ArrayQueue()
Constructs an empty queue. This constructor is equivalent to the call of ArrayQueue(0, new Object[0]).

ArrayQueue

public ArrayQueue(Iterator iterator)
Constructs a queue containing the elements of the specified iterator. This constructor calls the void constructor and uses the insertAll method to insert the elements of the specified iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the iterator whose elements are to be placed into this queue.
Method Detail

insert

public void insert(Object object)
Appends the specified element to the end of this queue. Before the element is inserted the internally used array may be resized automatically depending on its growth policy.
Overrides:
insert in class AbstractQueue
Parameters:
object - element to be appended to the end of this queue.

peek

public Object peek()
            throws NoSuchElementException,
                   UnsupportedOperationException
Returns the next element in the queue without removing it. The next element is the value of the component of the internally used array which is pointed by the index first.
Overrides:
peek in class AbstractQueue
Returns:
the next element in the queue.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - queue has no more elements.
UnsupportedOperationException - if the peek operation is not supported by this queue.

next

public Object next()
            throws NoSuchElementException
Returns the next element in the queue. The next element is the value of the component of the internally used array which is pointed by the index first.
Overrides:
next in class AbstractQueue
Returns:
the next element in the queue.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - queue has no more elements.

get

public Object get(int index)
           throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Returns the value of the indexed component in this queue.
Parameters:
index - the index of the component in this queue.
Returns:
the value of the indexed component in this queue.
Throws:
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified index argument is negative, or if it is greater than or equal to the length of this queue.

                Object object)
         throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified index argument is negative, or if it is greater than or equal to the length of this queue.

size

public int size()
Returns the number of elements in this queue. If this queue contains more than Integer.MAX_VALUE elements, returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.
Overrides:
size in class AbstractQueue
Returns:
the number of elements in this queue.

supportsPeek

public boolean supportsPeek()
Returns true if the peek operation is supported by this queue. (In other words, returns true if peek would return an element rather than throwing an exception.)
Overrides:
supportsPeek in class AbstractQueue
Returns:
true if the peek operation is supported by this queue.

clear

public void clear()
Removes all of the elements from this queue. The queue will be empty after this call returns so that size() == 0.
The internally used array will be replaced by an empty array and the fields size and first will be set to 0.
Overrides:
clear in class AbstractQueue

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use an ArrayQueue. It can also be used to test the functionality of an ArrayQueue.
Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
